SEARCH
Module paths
Package ntnu.idatt2001.ejhaslerjorgfi.model

Class Link

java.lang.Object
ntnu.idatt2001.ejhaslerjorgfi.model.Link
public class Link extends Object

Link

Definition

Represents a path or a connection between different parts of the story. Links connects Passage objects together. A Player may move through Passage objects through Links.

Functionality

Links may contain one or several objects implementing the Action interface, which are capable of affect a Player object's abilities. Each Link can be considered to represent a decision or an option which a Player may choose, determining the future development of the story.

Attributes

A Link contains a descriptive text which indicates an option or action in the story. This description is what will be visible to the Player.

The reference field contains a String which acts as an identifier to a Passage which a Link object leads to. One should note that Passages are singly linked together, meaning that a Link allows a Player to move from a Passage A to a Passage B, but not from Passage B and back to Passage A.

Link objects holds a collection of Action objects. Each Action instance represents an option which a Player may choose. The Action object may affect different attributes of a Player, and can be considered to be a minor event which a Player may encounter during the story.

Since:
12.02.2023
Version:
27.02.2023
Author:
Group 24

  • Constructor Details

    • Link

      public Link(String text, String reference)
      Creates a new instance of the Link class with its text, representing the nature of the event encountered at the Link as well as a reference to the Passage object it leads to.
      Parameters:
      text - the text which are to be displayed in the Link.
      reference - the reference to the leading Passage.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the text parameter or reference parameter has the value 'null'.
      BlankStringException - If the text argument or reference argument is either an empty string or consist only of white spaces. Utilizes the .blank() method of the String-class.
